verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329>, A Psalm <WH4210> of David <WH1732>. The heavens <WH8064> declare <WH5608> the glory <WH3519> of God <WH410>; and the firmament <WH7549> sheweth his <WH5046> handywork <WH4639> <WH3027>.
Day <WH3117> unto day <WH3117> uttereth <WH5042> speech <WH562>, and night <WH3915> unto night <WH3915> sheweth <WH2331> knowledge <WH1847>.
There is no speech <WH562> nor language <WH1697>, where their voice <WH6963> is not heard <WH8085>. where: or, without these their voice is heard: Heb. without their voice heard

Their line <WH6957> is gone out <WH3318> through all the earth <WH776>, and their words <WH4405> to the end <WH7097> of the world <WH8398>. In them hath he set <WH7760> a tabernacle <WH168> for the sun <WH8121>, line: or, rule, or, direction
Which is as a bridegroom <WH2860> coming out <WH3318> of his chamber <WH2646>, and rejoiceth <WH7797> as a strong man <WH1368> to run <WH7323> a race <WH734>.
His going forth <WH4161> is from the end <WH7097> of the heaven <WH8064>, and his circuit <WH8622> unto the ends <WH7098> of it: and there is nothing hid <WH5641> from the heat <WH2535> thereof.

The law <WH8451> of the LORD <WH3068> is perfect <WH8549>, converting <WH7725> the soul <WH5315>: the testimony <WH5715> of the LORD <WH3068> is sure <WH539>, making wise <WH2449> the simple <WH6612>. law: or, doctrine converting: or, restoring

The statutes <WH6490> of the LORD <WH3068> are right <WH3477>, rejoicing <WH8055> the heart <WH3820>: the commandment <WH4687> of the LORD <WH3068> is pure <WH1249>, enlightening <WH215> the eyes <WH5869>.

The fear <WH3374> of the LORD <WH3068> is clean <WH2889>, enduring <WH5975> for ever <WH5703>: the judgments <WH4941> of the LORD <WH3068> are true <WH571> and righteous <WH6663> altogether <WH3162>. true: Heb. truth

More to be desired <WH2530> are they than gold <WH2091>, yea, than much <WH7227> fine gold <WH6337>: sweeter <WH4966> also than honey <WH1706> and the honeycomb <WH5317> <WH6688>. the honeycomb: Heb. the dropping of honeycombs
Moreover by them is thy servant <WH5650> warned <WH2094>: and in keeping <WH8104> of them there is great <WH7227> reward <WH6118>.
Who can understand <WH995> his errors <WH7691>? cleanse <WH5352> thou me from secret <WH5641> faults.

Keep back <WH2820> thy servant <WH5650> also from presumptuous <WH2086> sins; let them not have dominion <WH4910> over me: then shall I be upright <WH8552>, and I shall be innocent <WH5352> from the great <WH7227> transgression <WH6588>. the great: or, much

Let the words <WH561> of my mouth <WH6310>, and the meditation <WH1902> of my heart <WH3820>, be acceptable <WH7522> in thy sight <WH6440>, O LORD <WH3068>, my strength <WH6697>, and my redeemer <WH1350>. strength: Heb. rock
